intro: Lactuca grandicolla, commonly known as the giant lettuce, is a species of flowering plant in the Asteraceae family. It is native to the Mediterranean region and is characterized by its large, broad leaves that can grow up to 30 centimeters in length. The plant produces yellow flowers in composite flower heads, typical of the daisy family. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or arid environments. Lactuca grandicolla is sometimes cultivated for ornamental purposes due to its striking foliage.
